reviews.review_msg: james was a caring prof. the lectures were long but he was always willing to help his students.
Fun and engaging classes with a passionate prof. Lectures are long but worth it - use unstuck study alongside the textbook to ace this class.

One of the best professors at SFU for polisci. I've had James 2x before and im in the middle of my 3rd course w/ him. Is super chill (even in a 400-level course), also kind and approachable. He uses the exact same grade weight in all of his classes so you know what to expect. Lectures are long but u can tell he's passionate about what he teaches!!

His lectures are very interesting and you can tell he is passionate about the subject. This makes his 4 hour evening seminars engaging and encourages interesting in class discussions. Unfortunately, the course material is incredibly difficult and he assigns an impossible amount of weekly reading. Hardest class I've ever took.

Pol 344 regards international law so it is a pretty boring class. James manages to make it a total snooze fest. He is out of the country and is lecturing at what for him is the middle of the night. 0 engagement with students - he ignores questions asked in chat. Easy class to take it is just boring and insanely boring. Take home exam as well.

Horrible prof. Takes forever to reply to his email, forever to mark our assignments and doesn't even give it back to us. His instructions are so ambiguous and he does not want to help his student in any way. I suggest to avoid him because online is already hard and he does not make it any easier..

Avoid him. Did all his assignments and received 0 back even after the final, still nothing. I've heard he is a hard marker which I guess is true but again how would I know if he does not hand back our assignment on time?!!?!? You will learn nothing in this class and you won't even get a good mark so just avoid him!

The course content is very dry, and James did his best in teaching it. The course is also more IR than poli sci, so be aware of that. Three papers in total, plus weekly discussion on Canvas. His marking criteria for the papers wasn't very clear and he is extremely slow in marking - we got our midterm paper grade after classes had ended!

Absolutely unreachable online. You have to send 3 emails for him to send back a super short response 2 weeks later if you are lucky. This was especially annoying when we needed his approval for our essay topics and he would just not respond to emails. Overall, STAY AWAY from his online classes.

Long story short, we had to get his approval before writing a 15-page term paper. I reached out a week in advance and he took 4 days to reply to my emails. Showed no urgency for students. It tanked my mental health and schedule, and I ended up reaching out to my advisor and the department chair to get my late penalty appealed since he caused it.

Heard great things about James but taking him during a remote semester - he's horrible. He has no office hours so the only way to reach him was through email; but he literally either doesn't reply, replies with days in between, or replies only responding to half of your email. Basically unreachable, and not who you want as a prof during a pandemic.

if you're the type of student who likes reaching out the a prof or TA for extra clarification, I DO NOT recommend taking any courses with this prof. Getting in contact with him is impossible as he takes forever to respond to emails. He also ignores some questions in your emails if he doesn't feel like answering them.
Is not actually available when you ask for help. Heard through other students as well as experienced myself him not responding to emails when asking questions about assignments. Not helpful.

Took 2 classes with him which were moved online due to Covid-19, could tell he was very out of his element teaching over Zoom but he really made the best of it and managed to make the classes engaging. Super knowledgeable prof and great lecturer, still hoping I can take an in person class with him before I graduate.

he is a nice person, but reaching out to him is almost impossible and due to that, my marks were heavily affected. Unfortunately, in university, niceness can only take you so far. I expect a complete ability for students to access a professor, and that was impossible with James. on top of that, a very hard marker!
Amazing prof, very nice with the marks. Learnt a lot from him. He is fun
His classes are fun and engaging.
James teaches the course in a straightforward way and is very nice to his students. He also keeps the class engaged and thinking about international theories and concepts.
He is friendly with marking and knows how to teach. The best!!!

I appreciated how James was understanding and reasonable when it came to completing assignments, ie. if you explain you are having difficulty he will help you. The lectures, however, were one-sided, and if you did not take the 'left-wing' position, your views were not seen as valid. This class was mostly about  racism. Assignment load was fair.
James won't give out easy As but if you do the work critically and participate in lecture you'll do great.

He was very passionate on the topics he chose to discuss with us in class. The lectures were organised. However, everything else was very chaotic (e.g. he forgot to show up, asked the wrong group to present, and did not follow the syllabus). Useless advice, not accessible for extra help. The final group project was disastrous as well.
Not as bad as what others say. The course content is very direct and as long as you can read and comprehend the course notes, you'll do fine.
a dynamic lecturer who will challenge to get beyond your comfort zone in comprehending the subject

haunted by regret for not sending in a course eval about this Prof. the course material was easy, assignments were mostly clear. my beef is that he returned no grades after the 1st assignment of the semester, did not return any emails about getting grades/feedback on the final paper or final exam. so u got ur final mark with 0 justification

When I took this class the professor was on leave so had no office hours, but was also incredibly hard to reach with questions by email. The first assignment was supposed to be objective, but blatantly said my argument is wrong.

I have no issue with James, but if you are going to take a class of his online beware of his TA's. TA feedback was not helpful and was a bit unrealistic. I disputed my paper grade to James (successfully) because the TA didn't like the definition it was based off of. The definition I used was explicitly stated in the course material...

Took online Pol 344 - Int'l Law with James.  Course shouldnt be taught online, such a poor way to learn such material.  He takes a while to get back to you, like 2 days minimum.  Not too many assignments but ongoing online participation, cant just bs your way through the course.  Asks the big questions.  A fair bit of writing . Okay. No textbooks!

Wow, terrible online class.  Very little direction, takes a week to get back to your email, if at all. Instructions not clear and doesn't answer students questions in a timely manner. Poor feedback, no help in providing suggestions for doing better.  Project turn around time is too long. This Instructor just doesn't have the time for his students.

I found his grammar and vocabulary to be needlessly complicated. The questions on the final were a paragraph long, but easily could have been rephrased much shorter and simpler. Very little feedback on assignments. It took weeks to get a grade on the first assignment. Two weeks after class now, and still no marks for research paper or final.

Most passionate prof I've ever had. He lives much of the year in Ghana so he has a first hand approach to much of the issues discussed in the course. He gives a clear cut definition of many things, and really forces you to think critically in his lectures rather than just write down definition. Highly recommend his classes!

I took this course online but he put a lot more work into it than other profs. He filmed his lectures & posted them online which helped enormously.  He did expect us to do readings and post weekly answers to his discussion questions but almost all my online courses require that. I would have gotten a higher mark but I didn' finish the weekly posts

One of the best professors in the department, in my opinion. Really knows his stuff, and is very helpful (if you can sum up the courage to approach him). Don't expect an A+ though, unless you are flawless in all components of the class. Finally, don't think of sucking up to him because it is pointless. He expects you to work hard for your grade!
Dr. James is a very knowledgeable rof who makes you think critically and outside the box
James is an incredible lecturer. It's like watching Morgan Freeman and Forest Whitaker. I was hoping for an A mark, but received a B mark. Pol Sci is not my major, but I did try my best.

The lectures were barely audible from anywhere but the front row. It was tough to tie any of the lectures into the final paper topic because nothing lined up. So I had no clue what he wanted to see as far as the paper went. VERY easy to get off topic, some lectures became glorified office hours for the in class suck ups...

Incredibly inspiring. His lectures really challenged me to think critically. He does run off topic sometimes though. Exams and papers are hard to write, because you can't regurgitate what he talked about in class. Great course, amazing prof. Made me excited to get to class at 8:30AM, hahaha.
He was the most inspiring professor I had though out university - brilliant professor
Excellent lecturer

Bring lots of paper or a computer with a large hard drive. Be sure to sit at the front or close enough to hear everything. Dont be afraid to ask him to repeat things as he can get into a topic and go for an hour non stop. ALL if it is Testable! The course material doesn't seem to be as important as his lecture notes. Not an easy "A" but youll learn
Intimidating class at first, but Busumtwi-sam is extremely helpful when you ask for his assistance. Lectures were interesting - but long - and you'll come out of this class having learned something.

Crystal clear; so much that by merely regurgitating what he said in lecture, you will NOT do well on the exam.  You must understand his ideas and then engage them intelligently, and by requiring this, James makes you think for yourself.  You WILL learn a lot from him; he is demanding, and because of this, you will come away from his class smarter.
This prof knows his stuff and is very enthusiastic about teaching.  He runs a tight clas but is very knowledgable and clealry cares about the students. An inspiring prof.
James is the best professor at SFU. I love his passion for Poli Sci... If you get the chance, take his classes!!!! He will work you but he's amazing and makes learning enjoyable.
The BEST prof ever!
This course was great!  He's a wonderful lecturer and doesn't belittle anyone for their input.  I highly recommend this particular professor.

by far the best course i've ever taken, and the best prof i've ever had. lectures were extremely loaded with info, but not presented in such a way that it was overwhelming. term paper was heavy (15 pages) but topics were appropriate to the length. take-home final, which was easy.

A very charming fellow. He gives lectures with a passion and intensity that really makes attending enjoyable. He also tries to get the class involved as much as possible, and never talks down to us- a welcome change! I must say though, the class I took was agonizingly long. Even his charms start to wear off after three hours.
He is a nice professor. What was good about his course was that he would explain the concepts and write out the notes we needed, so we knew for sure what he was going to focus on for his exams.

If you appreciate a prof who actually organizes lectures and reveals interest in the course material, take a class from this prof.  Very intelligent, very knowledgeable, approachable in terms of asking questions during class.  A+.

SAM IS ONE OF THE BEST PROFF'S I HAVE EVER HAD. HE SURE KNOWS HIS STUFF! HE ALSO HAS AN EXCELLENT ABILITY IN RELYING THE MATERIAL SO THAT STUDENTS CAN GAIN A CLEAR UNDERSTANDING OF PERTINENT TOPICS IN THE COURSE. PAPER TOPICS ARE HARD. HIS TA'S ALSO MARK HARD. IF YOU NEED EXTRA HELP, IT'S AVAILABLE.

He really knows his stuff and his tests are easy enough b/c he tells you what's on them.  He makes the material very comprehendable...you don't even need the textbook because his notes include anything you need to know. The only complaint about him is his messy handwriting :( Oh, and my Ta was dumb.
No Comments

Great Prof, one of the best I've had, enjoys teaching, has great sense of humour and is very knowledgable.  Definatly has messy writing but his lecture is at a good pace.  Recommended and he uses the same course material from semester to semester so you can probably get the courseware used.
Awesome prof! Very clear (though bad hand-writing lol) and made even boring topics interesting.  My TA was great by the way and I didn't find the marking THAT hard.

Lectures and notes are extremely clear. Very interesting discussions in class. Tells you exactly what's in the exams. But they are long, so watch out for time. Don't bother with the textbook, his notes will suffice. Great prof!

best prof. to teach pol 100 so far from my opinion, great guy, amazing lecture notes, everything needed for midterms and finals, u get a good idea of whats gonna be on it from what he says, bad handwriting though, but hes a great prof.

Great prof, his lectures were really fun. His overhead notes are at a great pace and are all you really need for tests.. I don't even know why I bought the text. The paper topics were pretty interesting. You can sort of tell where he lies politically. I liked his accent, made notetaking challenging.

Great notes cause they really help u on midterms & finals. His handwriting - terrible. TAs are HORRIBLE; so try & switch ASAP if u sense u have a bad TA. He tells u whats on the midterm & final but they are all written answers, no MC. Keep up w/ readings. Term paper topics i found challenging.

Super knowledgable and makes boring subject interesting and easy to understand.  Not very approachable though, and TAs are AWFUL, they dont know much and mark wayyyyy to hard.  I would totally recommend James though, he rocks!  PS-he totally doesnt have a political agenda, what are u talking about?

excellent prof. makes good use of lectures, but handwriting is atrocious. still, he makes potentially confusing material very clear. also very clear on essay expectations and what to review for exams. not too approachable, always seems busy. hope for a good TA!

Pretty good prof. Talked to him once but was just asking to how to pronounce his name. If you have a prob with accent and ugly writing, don't even try. Not a lot of online help. But he can really teach. Hard to fall asleep in his class. Tests ARE LONG!! watch out. TAs are crap, can't mark.
Great Prof. Exam is long though. find it hard to finish within the time limit. but prof is really good. i don't like the class, but i guess that's just b/c i don't like poli sci.

he is a knowledgeable professor and very enthusastic about the subject. There should be a ratemyTA. The TA I had for this course marked extremely hard and unreasonably. Horrible experience with TA this semester!!!

hilarious guy who can laugh at himself.  again, handwriting and spelling are major issues:)  however, he makes everything very clear and makes sure that he says what he is writing.  also, he's good with questions.

very clear, although his handwriting is not. He understands that his notes are hard to read and makes sure everyone fully undrestands what is written. He is passionate about the subject and he always finds a way to bring in a little humour. Overall he seems really nice.

This prof is horrible! He is arrogant, absent minded, BORING, and has a political agenda of his own. In a first year class, I don't think it is appropriate to tell your students to vote for the BC Liberals.

Teacher is awesome. He writes out all the notes for you on the overhead at the perfect speed. He also gives out an outline for the exams. You don't have to read the text, but it is easy to read. He makes getting an good grade easy. THE TA'S SUCK! They don't know what they're doing or how to teach!

He is an awesome prof, explains things very well.  Information provided very relevant to the exams.  Too bad his TA's do not know how to mark.  TA has no clue about anything, lacks confidence, should never become a teacher.
Very nice professor, makes jokes and usually answers questions. Notes and tutorial readings are key during exams.

Busumtwi-Sam is a high quality prof. His detailed notes rendered doing readings virtually useless. He comes off as being a bit of a hardass after the first lecture but after a few lectures he lightens up and is interesting to listen to.

he doesn't try to trick you on exams, so your never suprised and know exactly what your going to be tested on. he hints on the essay topics all throughout lectures, so if your listening, you definatley will not be suprised when finals come around!
Interesting opinion that Politics can be understood like a hard science (which presonally I don't agree with). Intersting background, ok prof, nothing bad to say about him

Near-illegible writing, which is a definite problem, but that's basically the only one. He'll seem really gruff on the first day, but his bark is worse than his bite. He likes to listen to the ideas of the people in his class.
Very good, one of the best profs. I have ever had.  Very clear and lectures are always interesting.  I would highly recommend!!

he practically tells you what's going to be on the midterm! gives out sheets with definitions, all you have to do is know those and you'll get an A on the tests. overall, interesting and passionate prof, seems strict, but it's only on the outside!
hes really cool and fun to talk to. he really knows his stuff and for an intro class he made it fun
Damn good prof! Knows his material thoroughly, a fair marker, and excellent at provoking debate.
very dynamic however, usually unavailable for consultation ie. always in a hurry to leave. He also is a very difficult marker.
Very clear and consise - his notes are great too.
excellent!
super smart
Great prof, definitely made me interested in poli-sci. funny too! he writes as he talks so you can keep up with his lecture.
he writes tooooooooooooooo fast....can't read his writings AT ALL!!!!
WOW. So smart. A lot of readings, but also a lot to say. Take this course.
Run while you can... run and never look back!
Challenging, but my favorite POL class yet. Awesome lectures.
Simply the best
Good prof - kept me up at 9AM! Demands lots but knows his stuff
my first and last pol sci course
He's an assy professor, who writes too fast, and can't teach
No Comments
He gave a good review of elementary concepts
A genius in his own mind
Seemed pretty cool.  And I got a lot out of his course.
Lots of fun to watch
This guy gives you the goods.You'd better be ready to carry the load.
Very high standards with lots of reading.  Very clear and helpful though.
No Comments
Challenging and reflective. His classes are a real eye-opener.
